title: Nifty50 and Bank Nifty will rise or crash in September?
text:
The Finance minister yesterday has announced India's GDP has fallen to its 6 years low to 5%. The chart reflects that the market already knew it and already reacted to it.

So, traders shouldn't take trade predicting a fall in the next trading session because the news has already been priced in.

Nifty50 chart

On the above chart, we have drawn all the support and resistances for the Nifty50 for the entire September.

Things to note from the chart:-

It has broken the lower trendline (dotted blue line). RSI has given divergence with the price, showing a possible fall as the next move. Upper black line is very strong resistance and it has reversed from there for the last 3 times. There are no chances for Nifty50 to go above that. So, a fall below the lower black line will be an opportunity to short the Nifty and that breach of the level take Nifty directly near the 10,000. Also, RSI is showing a must to be given breakout for the next upside movement. Traders can watch the RSI to predict the price movement in advance and accurately.

Taking upside trades will be risky. Traders must short on every rise.
